definition: any heavy material used to stabilize a ship or airship, to make a ship steady with a ballast
details:
noun
- any heavy material used to stabilize a ship or airship
- an electrical device for starting and regulating fluorescent and discharge lamps
= synonyms: light ballast
- a resistor inserted into a circuit to compensate for changes (as those arising from temperature fluctuations)
= synonyms: ballast resistor, barretter
- an attribute that tends to give stability in character and morals
- coarse gravel laid to form a bed for streets and railroads
verb
- to make a ship steady with a ballast
= example: to make a ship steady with a ballast
